name: Spinach Paratha flatbread - Yeast free
description: Easy Spinach Flatbread, This recipe is soy-free, nut-free, easy and kid approved Makes 7 to 8 parathas or 10 to 12 rotis Prep time: 20 minutes, Active Time: 45 minutes
recipeIngredient: 1 cup packed chopped spinach  (or other tender greens)
1/4 cup unbleached white flour  (or all-purpose flour)
1/4 teaspoon carom (ajwain seeds or coarsely ground cumin seeds)
Safflower or melted vegan butter (for cooking)

recipeInstructions.text: Bring 3 cups of water to a rapid boil in a deep pot. Blanch the spinach for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain well, blend with 1/2 cup water and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring 3 cups of water to a rapid boil in a deep pot. Blanch the spinach for 3 to 4 minutes. Drain well, blend with 1/2 cup water and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the flours, salt and carom seeds. Add 1/2 teaspoon oil and the spinach puree and mix well. Add more water and knead into a slightly sticky soft dough. Do not knead for more than a minute. The dough will be sticky and soft.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, combine the flours, salt and carom seeds. Add 1/2 teaspoon oil and the spinach puree and mix well. Add more water and knead into a slightly sticky soft dough. Do not knead for more than a minute. The dough will be sticky and soft.

recipeInstructions.text: Spray or brush oil on the dough, cover with a kitchen towel and let the dough sit for 15 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Spray or brush oil on the dough, cover with a kitchen towel and let the dough sit for 15 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Oil hands and knead for a minute. Add tablespoon of flour if needed. Divide dough into equal parts and shape into balls. Keep the balls covered by the kitchen towel.
recipeInstructions.name: Oil hands and knead for a minute. Add tablespoon of flour if needed. Divide dough into equal parts and shape into balls. Keep the balls covered by the kitchen towel.

recipeInstructions.text: Flatten a ball and dust completely with flour. Roll the ball into a flat round. Brush the paratha with oil or melted vegan butter. Fold the rolled dough into a square or laccha style. Roll it out and proceed to cook. You can also stuff this paratha with potatoes, cauliflower or radish.
recipeInstructions.name: Flatten a ball and dust completely with flour. Roll the ball into a flat round. Brush the paratha with oil or melted vegan butter. Fold the rolled dough into a square or laccha style. Roll it out and proceed to cook. You can also stuff this paratha with potatoes, cauliflower or radish.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat a thick bottom skillet at medium high heat. When the skillet is hot, place the rolled out dough in the skillet. Cook the flatbread for 45 seconds to a minute per side.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat a thick bottom skillet at medium high heat. When the skillet is hot, place the rolled out dough in the skillet. Cook the flatbread for 45 seconds to a minute per side.

recipeInstructions.text: Flip and cook the other side. Brush oil on the paratha and flip and cook for 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Flip and cook the other side. Brush oil on the paratha and flip and cook for 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Brush oil on the current side as well and flip and cook for 30 seconds or until nicely browned. Serve hot. Keep lightly covered with a towel until ready to serve. Store in paper towel lined container. Do not overcook the flatbreads. Cooking time depends on the thickness of the flatbread, so adjust accordingly.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush oil on the current side as well and flip and cook for 30 seconds or until nicely browned. Serve hot. Keep lightly covered with a towel until ready to serve. Store in paper towel lined container. Do not overcook the flatbreads. Cooking time depends on the thickness of the flatbread, so adjust accordingly.

recipeInstructions.text: Variation: Add a 1/2 teaspoon garam masala to the flours
recipeInstructions.name: Variation: Add a 1/2 teaspoon garam masala to the flours
